body.p:
Lexington Ky, Aug 28 -- 63
My dear Sir

This note will be handed you by James Donahoe of Lexington. He has a petition requesting the remission of a fine, inflicted in the Fayette Circuit Court. Feby 1862. Mr Donahoe is now acting as a good citizen and has abandoned the grocery business of the fine was made upon the testimony of a man, whose affidavit taken after the trial disproved all he testified to before Court.
I think his a case, which presents strong grounds for Executive clemency --
